answers.answer: What you are describing is definitely a common symptom of SSRI withdrawal but that doesn't necessarily mean that is what is causing your symptoms in your case.  You should get a physical examination to rule out a medical cause for your symptoms in case they are not related to Paxil withdrawal.Do you have any reasons to suspect you may be hypoglycemic?  Do your symptoms get better with sugar intake, etc?SSRI withdrawal symptoms can present from a day of stopping medication to weeks (and in some cases months) from taking the final dosage.  Even if a doctor-implemented tapering regime is followed, withdrawal symptoms tend to occur in a good proportion of people and many people have a lot of difficulty stopping the SSRI.Hang in there and see a doctor about your symptoms just to be sure.

question: i have recently stopped taking paxil by weaning off of it correctly. since then, i have these experiences where all of a sudden i feel like i am going to pass out, i get sweaty and weak and need to lie down. they are out of nowhere. i have read some stuff about how this could be related to something called paxil withdrawal. but i want to know...is it going to go away? should i wait a while? or do i now have hypoglycemia or blood sugar issues or even diabetes?
title: paxil withdrawal and blood sugar?
